attributes.additional_details:
MP's should pay the equivalent amount of contributions as other Public Services. ie..all MP's should pay 11% of their pay (same as Police Officers) to contribute to their pensions. If the contribution rate rises with changes then theirs should also.
After all the MP's get a handsome pension compliments of the tax payer. As they say - we're all in it together!

rejection.details: You may also be interested to see the announcement made by the Leader of the House of Commons in July 2011, which can be viewed at http://www.commonsleader.gov.uk/output/page3077.asp
